fields.description:
While reviewing a pull request [1] I noticed that in the third hunk, where the line numbers jump above 10K, that the line numbers on the old and new versions run together making it kind of hard to read.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/pidgin/main/pull-requests/19/luminanosity-contrast-check/diff
fields.summary: Pull request line numbers run together in files with 10K+ lines (BB-15811)
Webhooks for Issues `invalid_payload` error status 500

fields.description:
Bitbucket attempts to show the user's full name for the mention, but fails to linkify the names if the full name of the user contains an accent

You will get the username in the dropdown, and you are able to select.  However, when you save the comment, the username isn't actually mentioned or linkified.
fields.summary: Unable to link user's in Issues module if name contains accent. (BB-15774)

fields.description:
Bitbucket with the "Jira Link" feature, appears to only recognise jira issue keys with issue numbers up to 6 digits long. Longer numeric-parts of the issue key are incorrectly interpreted as commit hashes.

*HOST is the project key.

Bitbucket correctly recognises the following issue ids:

HOST-1234\\
HOST-12345\\
HOST-123456\\
The entire id appears as a link and correctly links to Jira.\\
However, as soon as the number part is longer than 6 digits, e.g.:

HOST-1234567\\
HOST-12345678
fields.summary: JIRA Issue doesn't accept more than 6 digits (BB-15773)

fields.description:
This happens when a comment is added on a context line that is >3 lines away from the modified line, but <=7 lines away (e.g. one click of the {{...}} 'Show More Lines' context expander). Comments outside of this range appear correctly and don't get collapsed.

!4158744712-2016-02-11%20at%2011.07%20AM.png|thumbnail!

!2123854050-2016-02-11%20at%2011.07%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show More Lines broken for comments just outside normal viewing context (BB-9226)

fields.description: After several attempts, I was able to make only one successful commit, rest all attempts failed due to some "non-fast forward" error . However bitbucket commit log shows all commits by user (even the failed ones) which is very confusing. Someone care to fix this bug??
fields.summary: Commit log bug

fields.description: I was able to make only one successful commit out of several failed attempts due to a "non-fast forward" error.But even when there is a failed commit , bitbucket commit log shows all attempts of commit by user (even the unsuccessful ones) which is very confusing. Someone care to fix this bug??
fields.summary: Commit Log Bug

fields.description:
remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device

Looks like this has been posted here before. Can you take a look and help us please?\\
Please let me know if you need further information.
fields.summary: remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device

fields.description:
Hello,

I have problems with pushing my changes to remote repository.\\
Here is outpur message:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master\\
POST git-receive-pack (707 bytes)

remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device[K\\
remote: fatal: failed to write object[K\\
error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit

Pushing to https://kw-jeremic@bitbucket.org/kw-it/prolicht.proweb.cms.git\\
To https://kw-jeremic@bitbucket.org/kw-it/prolicht.proweb.cms.git\\
! [remote rejected] master -> master (unpacker error)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://kw-jeremic@bitbucket.org/kw-it/prolicht.proweb.cms.git'

Please help me, because whole team is waiting and we can not proceed further.

Best regards,\\
Milos Jeremic
fields.summary: Unable to push changes

fields.description:
I am getting this error when I try push

{code}
#!text

Counting objects: 47, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (32/32), done.
Writing objects: 100% (47/47), 4.50 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 47 (delta 19), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device
remote: fatal: failed to write object
error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit
{code}
fields.summary: Error sending commit

fields.description:
I wish it was possible to see the PR that a commit was part of.

Scenario:

# I look at a piece of code
# I annotate the file to see what commit changed the line
# I open the commit in bitbucket by searching for the sha
# *now I would like to get to the PR that this commit was merged with*

I need this to find out why the line of code was changed in context of a greater change and the link back to Jira that the PR was for
fields.summary: View PR from commit

fields.description:
Currently it doesn't seem there is any way to select which projects a repository should belong to from the repository itself.

I'd like to be able to choose the relevant projects from within the repo, as opposed to having to go to a project first and then selecting the repositories.
fields.summary: Need a way to add a repository to a project from within the repo

fields.description:
From within a project, when I try to add new repositories to the project, it brings up a list of all our repositories (currently 14 pages)

Can we please get the same "Find Repositories" filter/search mechanism from the Bitbucket homepage added to this page?
fields.summary: Search filter when adding repositories to a project

fields.description:
Since a few weeks mention only works for specific people:

!804956968-2016-02-11_001.png|thumbnail!

This is really annoying and always affects the same users. May have been introduced with projects scopes.
fields.summary: Mention only works for certain people

fields.description:
If you are scrolling issues and navigate to a page > 1, when you click on a value (for example "Milestone") to apply another filter, the URL value keeps the same page, which may be invalid for the new filter. For example:

# Open all issues. Scroll to page 3.
# Start applying filters by clicking on values in columns (for example, Milestone, Assignee, Priority).
# If your filtered list no longer has 3 pages, you will get a 404 error. You can fix it by changing the URL to "page=1".

For example, in my tracker it tries to load this URL: https://bitbucket.org/dilerlms/diler-digital-learning-environment/issues?status=new&status=open&page=2&milestone=5.0.2

This gives a 404 error. If I instead use this URL: https://bitbucket.org/dilerlms/diler-digital-learning-environment/issues?status=new&status=open&page=1&milestone=5.0.2

it is OK. I think the simplest fix is to always go back to page=1 when a new filter is applied.
fields.summary: Applying filter in issue tracker should reset page to 1 (BB-15812)

fields.description:
Attachments with ".", "-", " " or any other character special go to a dead link page.

For example (final link): http://......./001.HOME%20Exemplo%202.jpg
fields.summary: Dead link for all attachments
If latest test passed but recent test failed, PR marked as FAILED.

fields.description:
when you open a file you see a commit number. I understood it is the last commit number of the specific file, but it isn't, it corresponds to the last commit from all files. you have to either click for full commit or pick the commit from the list

!4197981545-bit.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Commit number/id bad referenced when you open a specific file and when you click full commit. (BB-14832)

fields.description:
!2498377363-Screen%20Shot%202016-02-10%20at%2016.18.36.png|thumbnail!

URL: https://bitbucket.org/david/django-storages/issues?status=new&status=open\\
OS: OS X 10.11.3 (15D21)\\
Browser: Chrome 48.0.2564.103 (64-bit)

Most ticket's cannot be accessed here because the ticket title (the only anchor) isn't visible in most of the tickets due to broken flexbox.
fields.summary: Tickets unaccessible due to broken flexbox

fields.description:
It would be nice if the default values for Repository and Branch matched the project that the given JIRA belongs to.  This would help guide users to do the "right thing" when creating their branches.

For example, in our process the default branch will be the feature integration branch for the given project (never the master or release branch).

To make this work the JIRA admin would need to be able to select different bitbucket defaults for each JIRA project.
fields.summary: Custom Defaults For Bitbucket-from-JIRA Create Branch Dialog

fields.description: This happens when you create a new branch from an existing branch that has no updates. If a new branch has been created, it will show immediately as "Merged" in the branch view. This can throw people off if they are looking into branch changes.
fields.summary: Creating a new branch from JIRA / Bitbucket shows new branch as 'merged' (BB-15813)

fields.description: This would be useful for groups that require merge messages explaining their merges. Another useful feature could be to add a description of the pull request in the merge automatically for any merges done (the message could be editable in the UI, if something custom is needed)
fields.summary: Prevent merges in the UI from allowing empty merge messages

fields.description:
A user should be able to add a file to an empty repository via the online editor, without first needing to initialize the repository on the command line.

The motivation for this feature request is based on experience in requiring my students to submit all of their code to a Bitbucket repository for grading (for the past three semesters).

Most of the students have never used the command line or SCM.  The class usually starts out with a month-long introduction to programming.

The first thing they do is set up a Bitbucket account.  Then, for the first few assignments, I have them submit their HW using the web interface (I have tried having them submit using the command line or a GUI, but this leads to too much confusion).

Ideally, this would be the workflow:

* Create a Bitbucket account.
* Create a repository using the web interface.
* Submit first 3-4 HWs using the web interface.
* Teach them how to use the command line or a GUI to clone repositories locally '''later in the semester''' after they become familiar with some of the repository terminology from using the web interface.

At present, the biggest hurdle is having them create a repository using the command line.  They make typos (often they copy the {{$}} character in the instructions and literally type {{mkdir /path/to/repository}}, even with explicit instructions not to do so), are confused by git warnings, and don't understand any of the repository creation commands.  This is a terrible way to start a class - each command line command requires an explanation that they are not ready for.  The GUI is even worse - they don't understand Git terminology and there are too many buttons to misclick.

Without the ability to create a repository with the web interface, I have decided that in the future it would be easier if I did it for them myself (20 students per class typically!).
fields.summary: Allow initial commit to be via the web interface

fields.description:
предварительные условия

# Шаги, зайти на сайт http://wordsy.ru
# Войти во вкладу "Показать все" "История просмотров" нажать на "любой флаг"
fields.summary: ошибка 500

fields.description:
Can you please stop the Import process on bitbucket

https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/788506
fields.summary: Stop Import Process on Bitbucket

fields.description: I've combed through Settings many times, but I cannot find where to change the logo on the repository. Can you please tell me where this is done?
fields.summary: Cannot change repository logo

fields.description: It would be nice if there is a functionality to search for snippets. This is particularly useful when there is a lot of snippets in a project or user account.
fields.summary: Ability to search for snippets

fields.description:
Since the introduction of projects, it might be useful to have actual features per project.\\
For example, I would like to use SSH keys for deployments, but limit this on a per project basis, instead of team basis.

Can you perhaps do this? - That way, the risk of leaking additional repositories goes down significantly.
fields.summary: SSH key's per project

fields.description:
To be able to see what goes on in my team, I'd prefer the teams pull request page to have a filter so it only shows PR's for one specific team, instead of for all teams.\\
Now I can only see open PR's for me, i'm watching and for all my teams combined. The last one is pretty useless IMO.

What I'd propose is a filter on the teams PR page on the general dashboard.\\
AND also a Pull requests tab on the teams and project pages.
fields.summary: Overview of pull requests per team

fields.description:
There are 6 different teams. Each team should have write access to X repositories, read access to Y repositories and no access to remaining ones.

Unfortunately with current BitBucket users management interface it is extremely hard to manage this. With old one it was possible to at least search on the page to quickly find some person in all groups and delete them when they leave the team. Now - you have to go through all groups one by one. It is really frustrating.
fields.summary: Improve users management
can't clone a repo that was created

fields.description:
I have an application that uses a user's OAuth credentials to download the contents of a repository as a tarball at a particular commit id.

According to my logs, everything was working well on 2016-02-04, and broke overnight into 2016-02-05.

The requests look like:

{code}
$ curl -i https://x-token-auth:ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/OWNER/REPO/get/master.tar.gz
HTTP/1.1 401 UNAUTHORIZED
Server: nginx/1.6.2
Vary: Accept-Language, Cookie
WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="Bitbucket.org HTTP"
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
Date: Fri, 05 Feb 2016 18:32:12 GMT
X-Served-By: app12
Content-Language: en
X-Static-Version: 93ed08e24088
ETag: "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e"
X-Render-Time: 0.0259521007538
Connection: keep-alive
X-Version: 93ed08e24088
X-Request-Count: 427
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
Content-Length: 0

{code}

If I use the same credentials to perform a clone, it works perfectly:

{code}
$ git clone https://x-token-auth:ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/OWNER/REPO.git                                                            
Cloning into 'REPO'...
remote: Counting objects: 375, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (201/201), done.
remote: Total 375 (delta 211), reused 285 (delta 163)
Receiving objects: 100% (375/375), 30.32 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (211/211), done.
Checking connectivity... done.

{code}

However, opening the download link in my authenticated browser session works and downloads the repository.

So is this a bug that's still intended to work, or will has this method of downloading the repository via API discontinued?

My application is currently broken for Bitbucket users as a result, and I need to know one way or another to keep or replace the functionality.
fields.summary: OAuth access to repository zip download returning 401 errors as of 2016-02-05

fields.description:
New try with more information as older request BCLOUD-5474 has been marked as invalid. Ping @mbertrand80 @zdavis

In issue tracker settings you can set default values for these all but you can't find out which value is the default via API. This information is useful when creating new issues using REST API. Maybe some boolean flag can be added to these endpoints:

[GET a list of versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/issues-resource-296095191.html#issuesResource-GETalistofversions]\\
[GET the components defined on an issue tracker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/issues-resource-296095191.html#issuesResource-GETthecomponentsdefinedonanissuetracker]\\
[GET the defined milestones|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/issues-resource-296095191.html#issuesResource-GETthedefinedmilestones]
fields.summary: Get default milestone/version/component via REST API

when I push my code to remote repository, get error message:"\\
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master\\
POST git-receive-pack (13919 bytes)

remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device[K\\

error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit"

what's wrong with it?
fields.summary: no space left on device when push operate.

fields.description:
On my BitBucket git repo, the Commits page shows a commit as being "16 hours ago" when it was both committed and pushed only 22 minutes (as is reflected properly on the Overview page).

When I look at my BitBucket settings, I see:

{code}
Location: No location chosen
Update these details through your Atlassian account.
{code}

I've changed my TimeZone @ https://confluence.atlassian.com/users/viewmysettings.action but that hasn't helped at all.  I see no way in all of the account management to get things to show other than "No location chosen."

I'm sure I'm missing some easy setting somewhere.  Things are not tied (as I'd expect) to the settings that I have been able to find and change.

This seems to have been reported in the past.  BCLOUD-16 looks related and there is a knowledge base entry @ https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Timestamp+Incorrect+in+Bitbucket+Server

The KB entry seems to only apply to "on premise" BitBucket installations, so it doesn't apply to me.  This article could be expanded upon to address my specific issue as they are very closely related.
fields.summary: Commit log on BitBucket shows improper timestamp

fields.description: Can you please help?

fields.description:
Hi.

Since there is a new feature now, the "projects" feature, I think it makes sense to allow the users create a wiki and issue tracker with a scope of "per project". The reason is some repos are somehow connected within the grand scheme of things, and it makes more sence to have the scope per project.
fields.summary: Make Issue Tracker and Wiki per project, not per repository

fields.description:
If a user is given permissions to read/write/admin a project or repository, but NOT added to the team that owns that project/repo, they are not considered part of that team, and that team name isn't shown in the Teams dropdown menu in the header.

The Teams menu should show all the team names that the user has been given explicit access to that team's projects/repos. This is similar to the behaviour of the 'Owner' filter option on the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Show implicit team membership in Teams menu if granted project/repository permissions

fields.description: If a user is added to a team, but the group that user is assigned to isn't granted either 'Manage' or 'Create Repository' permissions, then that team doesn't appear in the Teams dropdown menu in the header.
fields.summary: Teams dropdown doesn't show team if group permissions is 'None'

fields.description: There are several reports of users unable to update the custom links / regex in the Links section. When viewing the web console, there appears to be a 403 Forbidden error
fields.summary: Unable to update custom links under the "Links" section of a repository (BB-15739)

fields.description: It would be clearer if wouldn’t have the sentence  “and can administer all team repositories” from the description of users group access “Can Manage this team” since a team administrator doesn’t have access to a repo (unless he was added to that repo), he won’t be able to access that repository.
fields.summary: Improve description on Team groups

fields.description:
This issue occurs when using the [File Viewer|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/file-viewer-for-bitbucket-cloud/cloud/overview] add-on.

Expected behavior: When viewing a file in the Source tab, if that file can be viewed in one of the viewers included in the add-on, the file viewer drop-down is displayed on the panel:\\
!1496099827-2016-02-04_12-34-03.png|thumbnail!\\
A user selects a viewer and views a file in that viewer.

The issue: We discovered that viewer selection stopped working properly. To choose some viewer, you need to select it twice. Nothing happens after the first selection. You can see it on the video [here|https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7hotgePT6opdElJQW5WOFZrSnM/view%3Fusp%3Dsharing].\\
This issue appears to be on the Bitbucket side.

Could you please investigate and fix this issue?
fields.summary: Viewer is not being chosen after the first selection

fields.description:
This issue occurs when using the [File Viewer|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/file-viewer-for-bitbucket-cloud/cloud/overview] add-on.

Expected behavior:\\
When viewing a file in the Source tab, if that file can be viewed in one of the viewers included in the add-on, the file viewer drop-down is displayed on the panel:\\
!882918375-2016-02-04_12-34-03.png|thumbnail!\\
If a file can't be viewed in one of add-on's viewers, the file viewer drop-down is not displayed.

The issue:\\
If a file has extension typed in upper case and it's format is supported by the File Viewer add-on, the file viewer drop-down is not displayed, while it is expected that it would be displayed.

The add-on doesn't control when this drop-down is displayed. It is controlled by Bitbucket.

Can you make checking file extension case insensitive?
fields.summary: No file viewer drop-down when viewing files with extension in upper case (BB-15840)

fields.description:
As of now, users who creates a repository which is set to public with wiki and issue tracker selected will result with a public repository with public wiki and issue tracker. When users change the repository to private, wiki and issue tracker remains public.

But if users change the repository to private then the expectation would be that everything in the repository has become private.

Some better suggestions would be to:

* either give users two flags right upfront that allows users to select what user want to set as private
* or set everything as private and let users open it up.
fields.summary: When users change public repository to private -  wiki and issue tracker stays public without any form of warning.

fields.description: Currently, the only allowed methods are GET, and POST.  PUT would be a nice addition.
fields.summary: Add more methods to the Issues endpoint for API v2. (BB-15720)

fields.description: Shows up in Chrome / Firefox. When the build status icons are set on, the commit graph will be slightly misaligned in the 'Commits' view
fields.summary: Commit page with build status set will show misaligned commit graph (BB-15718)

fields.description: When users make commit comments, they do not appear in my RSS feed. They _do_ show up in the "Recent Activity" section however.
fields.summary: Commit comments do not appear in RSS feed (BB-15736)

fields.description: I am using [GNU SETL|http://setl.org/setl/] (Set Language) for some projects and I was wondering if it was at all possible to add "[SETL|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SETL]" as an available language type for repositories.
fields.summary: Add SETL to repository language options

fields.description: We're getting numerous reports that there are connections that are failing with "Packet corrupted" when trying to SSH to our servers. This is still under investigation by our network engineering team and one of our upstream providers (Level3) -- For now, this ticket will be a placeholder for notifications on any updates we come across
fields.summary: Users getting "Packet corrupted" from SSH sessions (BB-15701)

fields.description: When someone is invited to an account that is over the limit, the notice goes to the person invited, but I'm not aware that we send any notification to the account holder.
fields.summary: Send "Account limit" notification to account holder, not just invitee (BB-15700)

fields.description: When selecting a menu item on the manage repository settings, most items will be in bold. The "Deployment keys" selection is not.
fields.summary: "Deployment keys" menu is not highlighted when selected (Bold) (BB-15699)

fields.description: For those who are behind proxies where communication requires a reverse record, it would be nice to provide reverse DNS, instead of whitelisting our IPs.
fields.summary: Allow for reverse DNS on bitbucket.org (BB-15698)

fields.description: When using custom NVIDIA drivers (NVIDIA 750), the issue resolve dialogue tends to blur in Safari.
fields.summary: Blurry dialog for resolve and change status action (BB-15692)

fields.description: Projects in teams are not necessary for a small company and introduce arbitrary and unnecessary divisions. Please make them an optional feature.
fields.summary: Projects should be optional.

fields.description:
Previously, updating a WIKI via the REST API has worked. However, at some point, it looks like that functionality has been broken. Per the docs: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/wiki-resources-296095206.html#wikiResources-PUTapageupdate Here's an example: PUT https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/43accomplishments/wiki/Home\\ data = "Moo"\\ path = "/Home.wiki" Result:
  • path
    • Please choose a new title, Home.wiki aleady exists.
fields.summary: REST API: Wiki Update Doesn't work

fields.description:
Hello, I created a project but it is broken and can't repair from front-end.

* Add repos - Get a success message, however repos don't display
* Delete project - Get an error message "Unable to delete GHF Website. Try again later."

https://bitbucket.org/account/user/globalheritagefund/projects/GW

Sounds like the same issue reported here:\\
BCLOUD-9823
fields.summary: Broken project - repo's don't show, can't delete

fields.description:
We utilize the group feature in BitBucket extensively. We have over 25 groups. User can belongs to multiple groups. When someone leave the company or change teams. We need to remove user access from groups.

Currently there is no easy way to achieve that from ACCESS MANAGEMENT > User groups page! There is no way to search user based on user id, user first name, last name, anything!

The "User groups" page used to display all groups and the users within each group all on a single page. Previously, I would use the browser search feature and look up the user account based on their name since all user are on the same page. Once from, there could be multiple instance, I would remove access. However something change in your system about 2-3 months ago and now all groups are shown on one page and I have to click into the group to see users belong to the group.

Now if I need to remove a user and don't know which group the user belongs to (which is 99% of the time) I have to click into each group and manually look for the user. I am now very frustrated because this is such a time wasting task.

Therefore your UI "improvement" is actually increasing the time required for people to do daily tasks. It speak a lot about your development priority.

Please tell me I'm not crazy to expect that the ability to remove user access in a simple and quick manner.
fields.summary: Easy way to remove user access from all groups in a team

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a feature to update an issue upon commit as follows:

Insert a comment under the issue whose number is quoted in the commit message to show: changeset, user, commit message text.

This way, a reviewer can easily see everything from the issue tracker AND get an email notification averytime a commit is made that he/she has to review.
fields.summary: Update issue upon commit

fields.description: Give Date & Author Filter option in "commit view section", it will use to figure out the reports.
fields.summary: Filter option on commit view

fields.description: It would be good to be able to navigate within the UI from the commit page to the associated pull request (if it exists).
fields.summary: Add a link from the commit page to the associated pull request

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is a bug or a feature request. Put it as a bug, feel free to change as needed.

*Situation:*

I'm a member of a certain team with 3 groups:

* Junior
* Senior
* Admin

I'm part of the junior group

I've got a personal repository that's a fork of a team repository. Changes are committed on the personal repository. They are then integrated in the team repository by filing a pull request.

For this reason I want to give read access of my personal repository to our senior group like so:\\
!3071733127-Senior.png|thumbnail!

Since I'm not a member of the Senior group I can't see this group when I use the dropdown in access management:\\
!2755683191-Dropdown.png|thumbnail!

*Expected/wanted behavior:*

In access management of my personal repository I can select any group of our team in the dropdown and give that group read,write or admin access to my personal repository.

This in order to ensure a more straightforward method of configuring the way we handle pull requests

*Workaround:*

We've managed to give read access of my personal repository to the senior group by using the following method:

* Give a member of the admin group access to my personal repository (Admin access that is)
* Let him add the senior group in access management.
* Remove admin access to my personal repository for the member of our admin group.

While this method works and gives the same result, it requires admin members to stop their workflow and intervene in the process of getting any junior member up and running with the project.
fields.summary: Access management for different groups

fields.description:
We enjoyed the webhook, but it stopped working on 2015-09-24 (?) The webhook since then everytime gets a 500 from slack.\\
Thanks & Regards, Phil
fields.summary: Webhook slack repo:push returns 500 since 2015-09-24

fields.description:
A user requested for the ability to use API to filter projects, and also said:

bq. Let me tell you a bit about why this would be helpful.


bq. We're a WordPress shop, and I'm building a plugin that grabs from our BB repo to install and update WordPress themes and plugins on our production environment (or any server,   local, whatever). It would make the code far less resource-intensive if I could divide my repos between themes and plugins, and I think BB "projects" is the perfect way to make that distinction. I suspect many other WordPress devs would agree!
fields.summary: API to filter projects

fields.description:
Hi,

Always when I try to embed images into Markdown (.md) files in Bitbucket Server, the resulting layout in the generated HTML page differs quite a lot from most other Markdown presentations.\\
The biggest issue is that Bitbucket Server adds padding, margin and border CSS styles to the images, which is not done in most other Markdown renderers (e.g. MarkdownPad2 or GitHub).

I attached a screenshot with the Bitbucket Server generated HTML and the HTML generated by the MarkdownPad 2 editor that I use to create the files, side by side.

Left is the Bitbucket Server version of the generated HTML/CSS.\\
Right is the MarkdownPad exported HTML/CSS.

On the left side (Bitbucket Server) all the images are offset and use a border because of the CSS properties that are applied. This disrupts the expected layout of the images in the markdown a lot, you can see the expected layout quite nicely on the right side.

For a fix I used the chrome dev tools to set padding, margin and border = 0 in the Bitbucket HTML and it fixed the layout of the image that I tried it on (see example in the screenshot),

Can you please fix the styling of the HTML that is generated by Markdown in Bitbucket Server ... also some other styles look a lot different from e.g. GitHub Markdown in comparison.\\
For example the headings (h1-h6) in GitHub Markdown seem to use a bold font style, where the Bitbucket style does not ... so more consistency with the common Markdown look across all Markdown elements in Bitbucket Server would be nice and improve the reading experience imo.

PS: I'm using the latest Bitbucket Server v4.3.2

Thanks
fields.summary: Inline images in Markdown files (.md) use border, padding & margin settings that prevent proper HTML layout

fields.description:
Currently, the beta interface for projects implies that the relationship between projects and interfaces is one to many.\\
E.g. 1 Project has many Repositories, and 1 Repository can only ever belong to one project

I think it is better served as a many to many.

E.g. 1 Project has many Repositories, but 1 Repository can belong to many projects.

Here's my reasoning... I would like to visualize in some way all the dependencies that my project has. For example, lets assume that I have a package that I use across multiple projects, e.g. a CSS framework, an authentication package, a specific API interface, or even a jQuery plugin that I wrote.

With the new interface, I could theoretically visualize all the dependencies for *A Project* , but if I made a new project that is relatively similar, I can't visualize it in the same way, I can't add the same repositories as the current relationship is only 1 to Many.
fields.summary: Allow the same repository to be added to multiple projects

fields.description:
Public projects show title of _private issues_ in recent activity. For example: [this one|https://bitbucket.org/haibison/wake-lock-service].

I think all info of private issues should be hidden from Recent activity section.

Would you please check?

Thank you,
fields.summary: Recent activity shows history of private issues made by project members (BB-15691)

fields.description: With the build status api, its now possible to show build status within the pull request. It would be ideal if you were able to restrict the merge/approval of a pull request if the build hasn't passed (i.e. in progress/not run/failed).
fields.summary: Prevent pull request from being merged if build isn't success

fields.description:
The Bitbucket cloud REST API does not support branch creation / deletion. However the REST API for Bitbucket server does as found in the link below:

https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/bitbucket-server/4.3.1/bitbucket-rest.html#idp2564976

Use case: we want to standardize and automate the branch creation process and would most prefer to do this via the REST API. Delete would be nice too.
fields.summary: Add support to create / delete branch via REST API in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Assume a user is not allowed to push to a specific branch. That user made a new commit on that branch in a local repository, and added a tag onto the commit.

Pushing the tag will cause the commit to be pushed as well, though the commit wouldn't show in the history of the branch, but rather it will show when the specific commit URL is searched.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create new branch (and lock it on bitbucket).\\
_With a user who is not allowed to push to that branch:_
# Make a commit
# Add tag on that commit
# Push to bitbucket
# Go the url for that specific commit

It will show in a specific commit URL:\\
https://bitbucket.org/username/repositoryname/commits/xxxxxxx

But it won't show up in the branch commit history log:\\
https://bitbucket.org/digipolisgent/username/repositoryname/commits/branch/branchname
fields.summary: Pushing a commit on a restricted branching with a tag allows the push to go through partially. (BB-15735)

fields.description:
Repeated "https://bitbucket.orghttps://bitbucket.org" in plain text email of an invite:

----
MIME-Version: 1.0\\
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"\\
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

You have been invited by xxxxx to become a contributor to xxx/xxxx on bitbucket.org.

Accept your invitation by visiting:

_https://bitbucket.orghttps://bitbucket.org/invitations/repository/xxxxx_

This invitation will expire in 30 days.

Cheers,\\
The Bitbucket Team

----
Workaround: Manually paste the invite link without it being repeated.
fields.summary: Repeated "https://bitbucket.org/https://bitbucket.org" in the accept link if user is sent an invitation via email that's in plain text (BB-15602)

fields.description:
According the new API doc, we can sort repository list with "update on":

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/version-2-423626329.html#Version2-Sortingqueryresults

However, the query for "https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/username?sort=-updated_on" is not working as of now, producing the error:

"Repository has no field named 'last_update'"

Perhaps the docs need to be updated as well?
fields.summary: Not possible to GET most recently updated repositories. (BB-15714)

fields.description:
It'll be great if there's the ability for admin to manage group permissions for teams to create, update and delete projects. It would be very inconvenient if user had to create all of the projects for developers.

A forth option on this screen to allow group members to create, update, and delete projects would be great:

https://gyazo.com/74b6cf969d8b3610ecdc0286e2300b51
fields.summary: Feature Request: Manage group permissions for my team to create update and delete projects

fields.description:
If you have logged in, and go to https://bitbucket.org/ -- then there is a section called "Filter By".

If I select a value for Owner (I have several values to choose from if that matters), then select "Untitled Project" from the Project dropdown, it produces 5 pages of results.

Page one looks like this as a URL:

https://bitbucket.org/?owner=MYTEAM&projectOwner=MYTEAM&projectKey=PROJ

If I click pagination links "Next" or "2" the URL is this:

https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview?owner=MYTEAM&project=Untitled%20project%20(PROJ;%2011068)&page=2

That's obviously not correct, and so when it goes there I lose the values of the "Untitled Project" and start seeing all the projects.

If I take the url: https://bitbucket.org/?owner=MYTEAM&projectOwner=MYTEAM&projectKey=PROJ and add &page=2 or &page=X it works fine.
fields.summary: Root Overview Filtering Pagination Links Invalid

fields.description:
This is happening inconsistently.

If you have a team "Team A", and a project "Project A" and a repository "Repository A" -- we are seeing instances of loading up:

https://bitbucket.org/team-a/project-a/admin and the dropdown value of "Project" is incorrect.

The breadcrumbs, conversely, are fine.

Happy to provide an existing repository this is happening on, it's private.
fields.summary: Repository Details - Project Value Incorrect

fields.description:
We're looking into this with Webhooks for now but I think this would be a great feature. I'm honestly surprised it doesn't exist.

Would like the ability to disable public repos for team XYZ unless an admin approves or creates the repo.
fields.summary: Support for disabling public repos for a team without admin consent

fields.description: If I Merge a pull request that is merge onto a bookmark, the bookmark should be at the merge commit of the pull request.
fields.summary: Pull Requests Merged ontop of a Mercurial Bookmark should move the bookmark forward.

fields.description: The (private) repo https://bitbucket.org/jampp/ruby is unavailable since I applied a stripusing the admin interface.
fields.summary: Repo unavailable after stripping changeset

fields.description: I few of us have Issue BCLOUD-7567, but I realise we're talking about an old ticket which has been marked as Invalid. Can it please be reviewed?
fields.summary: Issue #7567 isn't invalid

fields.description: Basing on markdown specification HTML comments should be treated as any other HTML blocks and left unescaped while parsing MarkDown (http://spec.commonmark.org/0.23/#html-blocks). At the moment BitBucket preview escape them. It makes using any doc automation tools hardly possible.
fields.summary: HTML comments shouldn't be escaped in markdown preview

fields.description:
Currently, if a user is part of a Developer Group with write only permissions they are able to  create a repository, once the repository is created their account is automatically added to the repository users permissions and given admin access for that repo overriding the group permissions.

It would be nice to have a team admin setting so users that are in a write only group are no longer added to the repo user permissions by default and honour the group permissions. ie. a Developer with write only access in the team can create repo but not delete, rename or change any other settings for that repo.
fields.summary: Option to only add repository owner to users once repository is created

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Have image with parenthesis in file name
# Upload image
# File will not render correctly when you hit 'Comment' button
fields.summary: Images with parenthesis in file name will not render on issues (BB-15670)

fields.description:
Would like the option to attach a text file to a pull request so that we can attach things like test results to a pull request so that the description area doesn't have to be cluttered with text we could attach.

Currently, it appears as though we can only add images as attachments.
fields.summary: Arbitrary attachments for pull requests

fields.description: GitLab has support for ["system hooks"|https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/blob/master/doc/system_hooks/system_hooks.md] which allow the system to trigger webhooks when events occur outside of a specific repository.
fields.summary: Webhook support for "extra-repository" events (e.g. new user)

fields.description:
Size of the repository is less than 700MB. Maximum file size is 64MB. The repository is public, I have created it and I wanted to clone it elsewhere.

I tried the following scenarios:

{code}
git clone --branch devel git://bitbucket.org/repo_path.git
Initialized empty Git repository in /localworkstation/repo_path/.git/
bitbucket.org[0: 104.192.143.3]: errno=Connection timed out
bitbucket.org[0: 104.192.143.1]: errno=Connection timed out
bitbucket.org[0: 104.192.143.2]: errno=Connection timed out
fatal: unable to connect a socket (Connection timed out)
{code}

and

{code}
git clone --branch devel https://bitbucket.org/repo_path.git
Initialized empty Git repository in /localworkstation/repo_path/.git/
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 405
# Then it hangs here indefinitely
{code}

I have tried to enlarge the buffer with {{git config https.postBuffer 800M}} but it does not work yet.

Any suggestions ...
fields.summary: Cannot clone just created public repository

fields.description:
I had finally set up everything so that people could mostly self organize as soon as they were in a group with the right permissions. Create repo's, fork, manage them, create wiki's etc. I think it is not necessary that an administrator controls every little detail of a team, if a team is perfectly able to manage that themselves.

With the introduction of the new Projects however, I once again have a set of work on my plate (the creation and further management of 'projects') that I wasn't really waiting for...

Please make it possible for:

* Groups to create new projects
* Groups to add and remove 'their' repositories to projects

And yes of course I could add one more person to the group of admin's, but that's not the point. It's about centralization vs decentralization of power. Management vs self empowerment.
fields.summary: Project administration

fields.description: The "delete avatar" link (project > Settings > Change Avatar > Delete Avatar) does not seem to work.
fields.summary: Unable to delete a project avatar (BB-15667)

fields.description:
If you're trying to move a repo from an individual account to a project, and there are more than one page of repos. For example: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/sampleteam-Vivian/projects/SEEDF/add-personal-repositories

Click on page 2 at the bottom, you get improperly redirected back to the 'Add repositories' page. For example :https://bitbucket.org/account/user/sampleteam-Vivian/projects/SEEDF/add-repositories?page=2

In this case, I do not have a second page of repos, so I get a 404 error.

The correct URL should be: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/sampleteam-Vivian/projects/SEEDF/add-personal-repositories?page=2
fields.summary: Wrong links on repo listing pagination when trying to add repositories from an individual account to a project (BB-15666)

fields.description:
Right now https://user.bitbucket.org redirect to http://user.bitbucket.org when accessing bitbucket pages.

Please server all pages over https by default and redirect http to https.

Thanks you!
fields.summary: https support for pages (BB-15715)

fields.description:
This may be a documentation issue, but we should either:

# Document the team api endpoint to include anything about projects
# Make the projects bit optional (not sure if this feasible)
fields.summary: Repo creation API endpoint needs new 'project' variable in requests (BB-15663)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a fork with owner a Bitbucket Team, if either {{Issue Tracker}} or {{Wiki}} are enabled in the Create fork page, this leads to a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Bitbucket
# Visit a repository's page (either under individual account, or under a Team account)
# Select *Fork* from the menu on the left
# In the page that opens, select as Owner a Bitbucket Team
# Click 'Advanced Settings'
# Enable both or either of the checkboxes *Issue Tracking* or *Wiki*
# Click *Fork repository*

h3. Expected Results
The repo is forked under the selected team

h3. Actual Results
A 500 error shows

h3. Workaround
Deselect *Issue Tracker* and *Wiki* in the Create fork page.
fields.summary: Creating a fork that has an Issue Tracker or Wiki enabled, in a Bitbucket Team, results in an error (BB-15659)

fields.description: There seems to be a bug calculating the above/behind commits for Mercurial repos when creating a branch.
fields.summary: "X commits behind Y. Sync now." message incorrect for Mercurial (BB-15655)

fields.description:
When adding personal repositories to a project, all the pagination links point to "/add-repositories" instead of "/add-personal-repositories"

Here is the URL of the page I am referring to without the unique project IDs: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<project_name>/projects/<key>/add-personal-repositories
fields.summary: Adding personal repos to project: Pagination links incorrect (BB-15657)
